content:
kristen WoodruffJanuary  

Students and faculty interested in Web site design are invited to attend the Designing Web Pages for Accessibility seminar Thursday PERIOD



The seminar will be held from  p.m PERIOD to  p.m in the CharlestonMattoon Room in the Martin Luther King Jr PERIOD University Union PERIOD

The seminar which is sponsored by the Office of Civil Rights and Diversity will be presented by David Williamson a computer technology professor at Purdue Universitys School of Engineering and Technology in Indianapolis PERIOD

The purpose of this seminar is to educate the faculty staff students and the general public on the fundamentals of creating a web site Rob Miller associate director of the Office of Civil Rights and Diversity said PERIOD

It will definitely be worthwhile and I encourage any faculty members and students to get more involved by attending todays seminar Miller said PERIOD

Christy Blew assistant director of the office mentioned that Williamsons presentation is part of this years Opening Doors  conference PERIOD

Opening Doors is a conference held once a year in January that is designed to educate and inform faculty staff and students on a variety of issues Blew said PERIOD

Williamson who is an awardwinning Web design expert will focus on the basics of creating an accessible web page for people with disabilities and for those who are interested in expanding their knowledge of Web site design a press release said PERIOD

The press release also mentioned that Williamson will inform the participants how to ensure accuracy the first time to avoid timeconsuming corrections later PERIOD

There is no registration required prior to attending the seminar and it is free and open to public PERIOD
